sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Upon my word of honor ! And he touched my shoulder with two fingers — do you understand ?

lg.l: Of course ! I suppose you brought him good news , Blumenfeld ?
The military telegraphist , standing at attention , hands

sp.speaker: TELEGRAPHIST
sp.p: A radiogram , Lieutenant !

lg.l: Slowly he puts his cigar on the window sill and enters the

sp.speaker: STEIN
sp.p: He 's a lucky fellow . You may say what you please about luck , but it exists . Who is this Blumenfeld ? Von ?— Did you know his father ? Or his grandfather ?

sp.speaker: RITZAU
sp.p: I have reason to believe that he had no grandfather at all . But he is a good comrade . Blumenfeld comes out and rejoins the two officers , taking up his cigar .

sp.speaker: STEIN
sp.p: Another military secret ?

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Of course . Everything that is said and done here is a military secret . But I may tell you about it . The information we have received concerns our new siege guns — they are advancing successfully .

sp.speaker: STEIN
sp.p: Oho !

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Yes , successfully . They have just passed the most difficult part of the road — you know where the swamps are —

sp.speaker: STEIN
sp.p: Oh , yes .

sp.speaker: RITZAU
sp.p: Great !

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: The road could not support the heavy weight and caved in . Our commander was very uneasy . He ordered a report about the movement at each and every kilometer .

sp.speaker: STEIN
sp.p: Now he will sleep in peace .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: He never sleeps , von Stein .

sp.speaker: STEIN
sp.p: That 's true .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: He never sleeps , von Stein ! When he is not listening to reports or issuing commands , he is thinking . As the personal correspondent of his Highness I have the honor to know many things which others are not allowed to know — Oh , gentlemen , he has a wonderful mind !

lg.l: Another very young officer enters , stands at attention before

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Sit down , von Schauss . I am talking about our Commander .

sp.speaker: SCHAUSS
sp.p: Oh !

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: He has a German philosophical mind which manages guns as Leibnitz managed ideas . Everything is preconceived , everything is prearranged , the movement of our millions of people has been elaborated into such a remarkable system that Kant himself would have been proud of it . Gentlemen , we are led forward by indomitable logic and by an iron will . We are inexorable as Fate . The officers express their approval by subdued exclamations of “ bravo . ”

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: How can he sleep , if the movement of our armies is but the movement of parts of his brains ! And what is the use of sleep in general ? I sleep very little myself , and I advise you , gentlemen , not to indulge in foolish sleep .

sp.speaker: RITZAU
sp.p: But our human organism requires sleep .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Nonsense ! Organism — that is something invented by the doctors who are looking for practice among the fools . I know of no organism . I know only my desires and my will , which says : “ Gerhardt , do this ! Gerhardt , go there ! Gerhardt , take this ! ” And I take it !

sp.speaker: RITZAU
sp.p: Great !

sp.speaker: SCHAUSS
sp.p: Will you permit me to take down your words in my notebook ?

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Please , Schauss . What is it you want , Zigler ? The telegraphist has entered .

sp.speaker: ZIGLER
sp.p: I really do n't know , but something strange has happened . It seems that we are being interfered with , I can n't understand anything .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: What is it ? What is the matter ?

sp.speaker: ZIGLER
sp.p: We can make out one word , “ Water ” — but after that all is incomprehensible . And then again , “ Water ” —

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: What water ? You are intoxicated , Zigler . That must be wine , not water . Is the engineer there ?

sp.speaker: ZIGLER
sp.p: He is also surprised and cannot understand .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: You are a donkey , Zigler ! We 'll have to call out — The Commander comes out . He is a tall , erect old man . His face is pale . His voice is dry and unimpassioned .

sp.speaker: COMMANDER
sp.p: Blumenfeld ! All jump up , straighten themselves , as if petrified .

sp.speaker: What is this ?
sp.p: BLUMENFELD I have not yet investigated it , your Highness . Zigler is reporting —

sp.speaker: COMMANDER
sp.p: What is it , Zigler ?

sp.speaker: ZIGLER
sp.p: Your Highness , we are being interfered with . I do n't know what it is , but I can n't understand anything . We have been able to make out only one word — “ Water . ” Then again — “ Water . ”

lg.l: See what it is , Blumenfeld , and report to me —

sp.speaker: ENGINEER
sp.p: Where is Blumenfeld ? I beg your pardon , your Highness !

sp.speaker: ENGINEER
sp.p: They do n't respond to our calls , your Highness . They are silent like the dead . Something has happened there .

sp.speaker: COMMANDER
sp.p: You think something serious has happened ?

sp.speaker: ENGINEER
sp.p: I dare not think so , your Highness , but I am alarmed . Silence is the only answer to our most energetic calls . But Greitzer wishes to say something . ... Well ? What is it , Greitzer ? The second telegraphist has entered quietly .

sp.speaker: GREITZER
sp.p: They are silent , your Highness .

sp.speaker: Brief pause
sp.p: COMMANDER Again turning to the door . Please investigate this , Lieutenant . He advances a step to the door , then stops . There is a commotion behind the windows — a noise and the sound of voices . The word “ water ” is repeated frequently . The noise keeps growing , turning at times into a loud roar .

sp.speaker: What is that ?
sp.p: All turn to the window . An officer , bareheaded , rushes in excitedly , his hair disheveled , his face pale .

sp.speaker: OFFICER
sp.p: I want to see his Highness . I want to see his Highness !

sp.speaker: COMMANDER
sp.p: Calm yourself , officer .

lg.l: Your Highness ! I have the honor to report to you that the
Belgians have burst the dams , and our armies are flooded . Water !

sp.speaker: With horror
sp.p: We must hurry , your Highness !

sp.speaker: COMMANDER
sp.p: Hurry ! I ask you to calm yourself , officer . What about our guns ?

sp.speaker: OFFICER
sp.p: They are flooded , your Highness .

sp.speaker: COMMANDER
sp.p: Compose yourself , you are not behaving properly ! I am asking you about our field guns —

sp.speaker: OFFICER
sp.p: They are flooded , your Highness . The water is coming this way . We must hurry , your Highness , we are in a valley . This place is very low . They have broken the dams ; and the water is rushing this way violently . It is only five kilometers away from here — and we can hardly —. I beg your pardon , your Highness ! Silence . The commotion without is growing louder . Glimmering lights appear . The beginning of a terrible panic is felt , embracing the entire camp . All watch impatiently the reddening face of the Commander .

lg.l: He strikes the table with his fist forcibly .

sp.speaker: Absurd !
sp.p: He looks at them with cold fury , but all lower their eyes . The frightened officer is trembling and gazing at the window . The lights grow brighter outside — it is evident that a building has been set on fire . The voices without have turned into a roar . A dull noise , then the crash of shots is heard . The discipline is disappearing gradually .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: They have gone mad !

sp.speaker: OFFICER
sp.p: They are firing ! It is an attack !

sp.speaker: STEIN
sp.p: But that can n't be the Belgians !

sp.speaker: RITZAU
sp.p: They may have availed themselves —

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Are n't you ashamed , Stein ? Are n't you ashamed , gentlemen ? COMMANDER Silence ! I beg of you — Suddenly a piercing , wild sound of a horn is heard ordering to retreat . The roaring sound is growing rapidly .

lg.l: Who has commanded to retreat ? Who dares command when I am here ?
What a disgrace , Blumenfeld ! Order them to return !

sp.speaker: COMMANDER
sp.p: This is not the German Army ! You are unworthy of being called soldiers ! Shame ! I am ashamed to call myself your general ! Cowards !

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Stepping forward , with dignity .

sp.speaker: Your Highness !
sp.p: OFFICER Eh ! We are not fishes to swim in the water ! Runs out , followed by two or three others . The panic is growing .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Your Highness ! We ask you —. Your life is in danger — your Highness . Some one else runs out . The room is almost empty . Only the sentinel remains in the position of one petrified .

sp.speaker: BLUMENFELD
sp.p: Your Highness ! I implore you . Your life — I am afraid that another minute , and it will be too late ! Oh , your Highness !

lg.l: Again strikes the table with his fist .

stage.stage: The same hour of night . In the darkness it is difficult to discern the silhouettes of the ruined buildings and of the trees . At the right , a half-destroyed bridge . In the distance a fire is burning . From time to time the German flashlights are seen across the dark sky . Near the bridge , an automobile in which the wounded Emil Grelieu and his son are being carried to Antwerp . Jeanne and a young physician are with them . Something has broken down in the automobile and a soldier-chauffeur is bustling about with a lantern trying to repair it . Dr. Langloi stands near him .

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: Is it a serious break ?

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: No — I do n't know .

lg.l: What is it , Doctor ? Ca n't we start ?

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Angrily .

sp.speaker: We 'll start !
sp.p: DOCTOR I do n't know . Something is out of order . He says it is n't serious .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Shall we stay here long ?

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Angrily . How do I know ? About ten minutes I think . Please hold the light for me . Hands the lantern to the doctor .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Then I will come out .

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: You had better stay here , Maurice . You may hurt your arm .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: No , mother , I am careful . Where is the step ? How inconvenient . Why do n't they throw the flashlight here ? Jumps off and watches the chauffeur at work .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: How unfortunate that we are stuck here !

lg.l: A bridge ! How can anybody drive across such a bridge ?

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: Yes , it is unfortunate . We should have started out earlier .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Shrugging his shoulders . Father did not want to leave . How could we start ? Mamina , do you think our people are already in Antwerp ?

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Yes , I think so . Emil , are n't you cold ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: No . It is very pleasant to breathe the fresh air . I feel stronger .

lg.l: I think we are still in the region which —

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Yes . What time is it , Doctor ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Then it is a quarter of an hour since the bursting of the dams . Yes ! Mamma , do you hear , it is a quarter of ten now !

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Yes , I hear .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: But it is strange that we have n't heard any explosions .

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: How can you say that , Monsieur Maurice ? It is very far away .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: I thought that such explosions would be heard a hundred kilometers away . My God , how strange it is ! Our house and our garden will soon be flooded ! I wonder how high the water will rise . Do you think it will reach up to the second story ?

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: Possibly . Well , how are things moving ?

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Grumbling .

sp.speaker: I am working
sp.p: MAURICE Look , look ! Mamma , see how the searchlights are working . They seem to be frightened . Father , do you see them ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: Jeanne , lift me a little .

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: My dear , I do n't know whether I am allowed to do it .

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: You may lift him a little , if it is n't very painful . The bandage is tight .

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Do you feel any pain ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: No . They are frightened .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Father , they are flashing the searchlights across the sky like madmen . Look , look ! A bluish light is flashed over them , faintly illuminating the whole group .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Right into my eyes ! Does that come from an elevation , father ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: I suppose so . Either they have been warned , or the water is reaching them by this time .

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Do you think so , Emil ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: Yes . It seems to me that I hear the sound of the water from that side . All listen and look in the direction from which the noise came .

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: Uneasily . How unpleasant this is ! We should have started out sooner . We are too late .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Father , it seems to me I hear voices . Listen — it sounds as though they are crying there . Many , many people . Father , the Prussians are crying . It is they ! A distant , dull roaring of a crowd is heard . Then the crash of shots resounds . Sobs of military horns . The searchlights are swaying from side to side .

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: It is they .

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: If we do n't start in a quarter of an hour —

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: In half an hour , Doctor .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Father , how beautiful and how terrible it is ! Give me your hand , mother .

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: What is it ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: I want to kiss it . Mother , you have no gloves on !

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: What a foolish little boy you are , Maurice .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Monsieur Langloi said that in three days from now I may remove my bandage . Just think of it , in three days I shall be able to take up my gun again !... Oh , who is that ? Look , who is that ? All near the automobile assume defensive positions . The chauffeur and the doctor draw their revolvers . A figure appears from the field , approaching from one of the ditches . A peasant , wounded in the leg , comes up slowly , leaning upon a cane .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Who is there ?

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: Our own , our own . And who are you ? Are you going to the city ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Yes , we 're going to the city . Our car has broken down , we 're repairing it . What are you doing here ?

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: What am I doing here ? Examines the unfamiliar faces curiously . They also look at him attentively , by the light of the lantern .

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Give me the light !

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: Are you carrying a wounded man ? I am also wounded , in my leg . I cannot walk , it is very hard . I must lean on my cane . Are you going to the city ? I lay there in the ditch and when I heard you speak French I crawled out . My name is Jaqular .

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: How were you wounded ?

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: I was walking in the field and they shot me . They must have thought I was a rabbit . Laughs hoarsely . They must have thought I was a rabbit . What is the news , gentlemen ? Is our Belgium lost ?

sp.speaker: Laughs
sp.p: Eh ? Is our Belgium lost ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Do n't you know ?

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: What can I know ? I lay there and looked at the sky — that 's all I know . Did you see the sky ? Just look at it , I have been watching it all the time . What is that I see in the sky , eh ? How would you explain it ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: Sit down near us .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Listen , sit down here . It seems you have n't heard anything . You must get away from here . Do you know that the dams are broken ? Do you understand ? The dams !

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: The dams ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Yes . Do n't you hear the cries over there ? Listen ! They are crying there — the Prussians !

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: Water ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Water . It must be reaching them now . They must have learned of it by this time . Listen , it is so far , and yet we can hear ! The peasant laughs hoarsely .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Sit down , right here , the automobile is large . Doctor , help him . I will hold the lantern .

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: Uneasily . What is it ? Bad ? Chauffeur , be quick ! We can n't stay here ! The water is coming . We should have started out earlier .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: What an unfortunate mishap !

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Agitated . They shot you like a rabbit ? Do you hear , Emil — they thought a rabbit was running ! Did you resemble a rabbit so closely ? She laughs loudly , the peasant also laughs .

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: I look like a rabbit ! Exactly like a rabbit .

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Do you hear , Emil ? He says he looks exactly like a rabbit !

sp.speaker: Laughs
sp.p: EMIL GRELIEU

sp.speaker: Jeanne !
sp.p: MAURICE

sp.speaker: Mamma !
sp.p: JEANNE It makes me laugh — it seems so comical to me that they mistake us for rabbits . And now , what are we now — water rats ? Emil , just picture to yourself , water rats in an automobile !

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Mamma !

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: No , no , I am not laughing any more , Maurice !

sp.speaker: Laughs
sp.p: And what else are we ? Moles ? Must we hide in the ground ?

lg.l: And now we must hide in the ground —
And they will remain on the ground ? Emil , do you hear ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: My dear ! My dear !

lg.l: Listen , you must do something . Have n't you anything ? Listen !
Mamma , we are starting directly , my dear !

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: No , never mind , I am not laughing any more . How foolish you are . Maurice , I simply felt like talking . I was silent too long . I was forever silent , but just now I felt like chattering . Emil , I am not disturbing you with my talk , am I ? Why is the water so quiet , Emil ? It was the King who said , “ The water is silent , ” was it not ? But I should like to see it roar , crash like thunder .... No , I cannot , I cannot bear this silence ! Ah , why is it so quiet — I cannot bear it !

lg.l: My dear fellow , please hurry up !

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Yes , yes ! I 'm working , I 'm working . We 'll start soon .

lg.l: But I cannot bear it ! I cannot !
Covers her mouth with her hands ; sobs .

sp.speaker: I cannot !
sp.p: MAURICE

sp.speaker: Mamma !
sp.p: EMIL GRELIEU All will end well , Jeanne . All will end well . I know . I also feel as you do . But all will end well , Jeanne !

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: All will end well , Jeanne ! Belgium will live ! The sun will shine ! I am suffering , but I know this , Jeanne !

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Quicker ! Quicker !

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: In a moment , in a moment . Now it is fixed , in a moment .

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: Faintly .

lg.l: Yes , yes , I know .... Forgive me , forgive me , I will soon —
A loud , somewhat hoarse voice of a girl comes from the dark .

sp.speaker: GIRL
sp.p: Tell me how I can find my way to Lonua ! Exclamations of surprise .

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Who is that ?

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Emil , it is that girl !

sp.speaker: Laughs
sp.p: She is also like a rabbit !

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: Grumbles . What is it , what is it — Who ? Throws the light on the girl . Her dress is torn , her eyes look wild . The peasant is laughing .

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: She is here again ?

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Let me have the light !

sp.speaker: DOCTOR
sp.p: Very well !

lg.l: How can I find my way to Lonua ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: Maurice , you must stop her ! My child , my child ! Doctor , you —

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Put down the lantern ! The devil take this !

lg.l: Hands off ! No , no , you will not dare —
Doctor , you must catch her ! She will perish here , quick —
She runs away . The doctor follows her in the dark .

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: She asked me , too , how to go to Lonua . How am I to know ? Lonua ! The girl 's voice resounds in the dark and then there is silence .

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: You must catch her ! What is it ? You must !

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: But how , father ? They listen . Silence . Dull cries of a mob resound . Jeanne breaks into muffled laughter .

lg.l: Now he is gone ! Oh , my God !

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: But the doctor is n't here . Oh , my God ! Father , what shall we do now ?

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Let us call him . Eh ! Maurice and the chauffeur call : “ Doctor ! Eh ! Langloi ! ”

sp.speaker: CHAUFFEUR
sp.p: Angrily . I must deliver Monsieur Grelieu , and I will deliver him . Take your seats !

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Shouts .

sp.speaker: Langloi !
sp.p: A faint echo in the distance .

sp.speaker: Come ! Doctor !
sp.p: The response is nearer .

sp.speaker: PEASANT
sp.p: He did not catch her . You cannot catch her . She asked me , too , about the road to Lonua . She is insane .

sp.speaker: Laughs
sp.p: There are many like her now .

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: Imploringly .

sp.speaker: Jeanne !
sp.p: JEANNE But I cannot , Emil . What is it ? I cannot understand . What is it ? Where are we ? My God , I do n't understand anything . I used to understand , I used to understand , but now — Where is Pierre ? Firmly . Where is Pierre ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Oh , will he be here soon ? Mother dear , we 'll start in a moment !

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Yes , yes , we 'll start in a moment ! But I do n't understand anything . Where are we ? Why such a dream , why such a dream ? I can n't understand ! Who has come ? My head is aching . Who has come ? Why has it happened ? A mice from the darkness , quite near .

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: Frightened . Who is shouting ? What a strange dream , what a terrible , terrible , terrible dream . Where is Pierre ?

sp.speaker: MAURICE
sp.p: Mother !

lg.l: I cannot — why are you torturing me ? Where is Pierre ?

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: He is dead , Jeanne !

sp.speaker: JEANNE
sp.p: No !! !

sp.speaker: EMIL GRELIEU
sp.p: He is dead , Jeanne . But I swear to you by God , Jeanne !— Belgium will live . Weep , sob , you are a mother . I too am crying with you — But I swear by God : Belgium will live ! God has given me the light to see , and I can see . Songs will resound here . Jeanne ! A new Spring will come here , the trees will be covered with blossoms — I swear to you , Jeanne , they will be covered with blossoms ! And mothers will caress their children , and the sun will shine upon their heads , upon their golden-haired little heads ! Jeanne ! There will be no more bloodshed . I see a new world , Jeanne ! I see my nation : Here it is advancing with palm leaves to meet God who has come to earth again . Weep , Jeanne , you are a mother ! Weep , unfortunate mother — God weeps with you . But there will be happy mothers here again — I see a new world , Jeanne , I see a new life !
